div.p: No. 71/3077, 1/2167 letters received, Colonial Secretary's Department, Archives Authority of New South Wales, Sydney.
MS written by Georg Luehmann and signed and adressed by M. MS annotated below the date: ‘1 May […]’. Melbourne Botan Garden

Allow me to inform you that I have just been requested by Dr Hermann Wagner the editor of the Gotha Hof-Kalender,
Gothaischer Hofkalender ( Almanach de Gotha ). Letter not found.
to obtain for him some summary of statistic data, concerning the trade, Customs, postal Service, telegraph Department, Census, railways, Volunteer force, mines, lands public expenditure and income, and any other data in reference to your Colony.

As the Gotha Kalender is universally used in the diplomatic service, and also otherwise much consulted all over the Globe, you may be pleased perhaps to accede to Dr Wagners request, and if so forward kindly to him direct any documents bearing on the statistic information desired — or entrust such documents to me for early transmission to Gotha. I may add that the information required is only for 1870 and that the documents should be forwarded by the May Mail.
'I may add … May Mail underlined in an unknown hand. See also M to J. Robertson, 17 March 1872 (in this edition as 72-03-17b).

div.p:
The honorable the Chief Secretary of N. S. Wales
MS annotated in an unknown hand, probably Robertson’s: 'May be permitted as far as practicable. 2 May 71', and initialled on 3 May 1871. A further annotation in a different hand reads 'It has been ascertained that no part of the 1870 Statistical Register is yet in type or even compiled. [8] May’, followed by yet another annotation, in the same hand as the note of 2 May, ‘May be so informed, but that when in print a copy shall be forwarded to him. 9 May 71'. The file was initialled again on 11 May 1871. A final annotation in another unknown hand reads: 'Registrar General. Dr Mueller. 15. May 1871.' Letter to M not found.
